gurmukhi: ieh BwNq sYn ju`JI Apwr ] rx roh kRoh Dwey luJwr ] q`jMq bwx g`jMq bIr ] au`TMq nwd B`jMq BIr ]420]
transliteration: Eh Bhaant Sain Jujhhiapaar|| Ran Roh Kroh Dhaae Lujhaar|| Tajjant Baan Gadjant Beer|| Outthant Naad Bhajjant Bheer||420||
translation: In this way, innumerable army fought and the warriors, in anger, and discharging arrows and thundering advanced forward; hearing the dreadful sound, the cowards ran away.420.

gurmukhi: Dwey sbwh joDw skop ] k`Fq kiRpwx bwhMq Dop ] lu`JMq sUr ju`JMq Apwr ] jx syq bMD idKIAq phwr ]421]
transliteration: Dhaae Sabaah Jodhaa Sakop|| Kaddhat Keipaan Baahant Dhop|| Lujjhant Soor Jujjhant Apaar|| Jaan Set Bandh Dikheeat Pahaar||421
translation: The warriors, in anger , marched forward with their contingents and taking out their swords, they bean to strike blows; the heaps of the corpses looked like the mountains lying on the sea-cost for building the dam.421.

gurmukhi: ktMq AMg BBkMq Gwv ] is`JMq sUr ju`JMq cwv ] inrKMq is`D cwrx AnMq ] aucrMq kiRq joDn ibAMq ]422]
transliteration: Katant An Bhabhkant Ghaav|| Sijjhant Soor Jujjhant Chaav|| Nirkhanndsiddh Chaaran Anant|| Ouchrant Krit Jodhan Beant||422||
translation: The limbs are being chopped, the wounds are oozing our and the warriors are fighting full of zeal; the adepts, minstrels and ballad-singers etc. are looking at the fighting and are also singing the praises of the heroes.422.

gurmukhi: nwcMq Awp eISr krwl ] bwjMq faur BY kir ibswl ] poAMq mwl kwlI kpwl ] cl ic`q c`K CwfMq jÍwl ]423]
transliteration: Naachannd Aap Eeshar Karaal|| Baajant Daur Bhai Kar(i) Bidaal|| Poant Maal Kaalikapaal|| Chal Chitt Chakkh Chhaadant Jvaal||423||
translation: Shiva, assuming his dreadful form, is dancing and his frightening tabor is being played; the goddess Kali is stringing the rosaries of skulls and is releasing the fire-flames, while drinking blood.423.

gurmukhi: bjy Gor bwjy ] DuxM myG lwjy ] Khy Kyq KqRI ] qjy qwx pqRI ]424]
transliteration: Bade Ghor Baaje|| Dhounan Megh Laaje|| Khahe Khet Khatree|| Taje Taan Patree||424||
translation: The dreadful war-drums sounded, hearing which the cloud felt shy; the Kshatriyas fought in the battlefield and pulling their bows, discharged the arrows.424.

gurmukhi: igrY AMg BMgM ] ncy jMg rMgM ] Kuly K`g KUnI ] cVy caup dUnI ]425]
transliteration: Girai An Bhanadg|| Nache Jan Ranadg|| Khule Khagg Khoonee|| Chade Chaoup Doonee||425||
translation: The warriors, with the broken limbs, fell while dancing, being absorbed in fighting; the fighters drew out their daggers with double zeal.425.

gurmukhi: BXo Gor ju`DM ] ieqI kwh su`DM ] ijixE kwl rUpM ] Bjy srb BUpM ]426]
transliteration: Bhayo Ghor Juddhan|| Itikaah Suddhan|| Jinio Kaal Roopan|| Bhaje Sarab Bhoopan||426
translation: Such a terrible war was fought, that none of the fighters remained in senses; Kalki, the manifestation of Yama, was victorious and all the kings fled away.426.

gurmukhi: sBY sYx Bwjw ] iPrXo Awp rwjw ] TitE Awx ju`DM ] BieE nwd au`DM ]427]
transliteration: Sabhai Sain Bhaajaa|| Phiryo Aap Raajaa|| Thatio Aan Juddhan|| Bhaio Naad Uddhan||427
translation: When all the kings fled away, then the king (of Sambhal) himself rotated and came in front and producing the terrible sound, he began the fighting.427.

gurmukhi: qjy bwx AYsy ] bxM pqR jYsy ] jlM myG Dwrw ] nBM jwxu qwrw ]428]
transliteration: Taje Baan Aise|| Banan Patra Jaise|| Jalan Megh Dhaaraa|| Nabhan Jaan(u) Taaraa||428||
translation: He was discharging his arrows as if the leaves were flying in the forest or the stars were falling from the sky.428.

gurmukhi: krM AMsu mwlI ] srM sqR swlI ] chUM Er CUty ] mhwN joD jUty ]429]
transliteration: Karan Ans(u) Maalee|| Saran Satra Saalee|| Chahoon Or Chhodhte|| Mahaan Jodh Jeete||429||
translation: He caused great loss to the enemies with his arrows; the arrows of the great warriors were discharged from all the four sides.429.

gurmukhi: cly kIt kwsy ] bFy itMF kwsy ] knM isMD ryqM ] qnM rom qyqM ]430]
transliteration: Chale Keet Kaase|| Badhe Tiddh Kaase|| Kanan Sindh Retan|| Tanan Rom Tetan||430||
translation: The arrows flew like the innumerable worms and locusts and they were countless in numbers like the particles of sand and the hair of the body.430.

gurmukhi: CutY sÍrx pu`KI ] suDMswr mu`KI ] klMkM kpqRI ] qjy jwx CqRI ]431]
transliteration: Chhoutai Svaran Poukkhee|| Sudhansaar Moukkhee|| Kalankan Kapatree|| Taje Jaan Chhatree||431||
translation: The arrows, with golden wings and steel tips, were discharged and in this way, the arrows with sharp tips were discharged on the Kshatriyas.431.
